original_title: Agreements with CEB, CPC trade unions for pay hike, bonuses to be terminated
original_body_lines: Collective agreements entered with the trade unions of state-run Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) and Ceylon Petroleum Corporation (CPC) for triennial salary increments, annual bonuses and allowances will be terminated, Minister of Power and Energy Kanchana Wijesekera said today.
Accordingly, the 25% salary increment given every three years, annual bonuses, allowances and other benefits will not be continued or renewed, the lawmaker noted.
“I have instructed Secretary to the Ministry of Power & Energy to commence the process to terminate them,” the minister said further in a tweet.
